tool.name: GEMINI @BINARY@
tool.command: gemini @BINARY@ --cases $cases --controls $controls $save_tscores $nonsynonymous $calpha --permutations $permutations #if float( str($min_aaf) ) >= 0.0: --min-aaf $min_aaf #end if #if float( str($max_aaf) ) >= 0.0: --max-aaf $max_aaf #end if "${ infile }" > "${ outfile }"

param.name: cases
param.label: Space separated list of cases for association testing

param.name: controls
param.label: Space separated list of controls for association testing

param.name: save_tscores
param.label: Save the permuted T-scores in the output file

param.name: nonsynonymous
param.label: Count all nonsynonymous variants as contributing burden

param.name: min_aaf
param.label: The min. alt. allele frequency for a variant to be included

param.name: max_aaf
param.label: The max. alt. allele frequency for a variant to be included

param.name: permutations
param.label: Number of permutations to run for the C-alpha test

tool.help:
**What it does**
The burden tool provides a set of utilities to perform burden summaries on a per-gene, per sample basis. By default, it outputs a table of gene-wise counts of all high impact variants in coding regions for each sample.
$ gemini burden test.burden.db gene M10475 M10478 M10500 M128215 WDR37 2 2 2 2 CTBP2 0 0 0 1 DHODH 1 0 0 0
@CITATION@
